intro.description: In this cheat sheet we are going to learn how to change the style of a layer.

item.title: Open Style Editor
item.description:
The style of a layer may be changed by opening the Style Editor.
Open up the Style Editor dialog by Right Clicking on the layer you wish to style and choosing Change Style.
Example: In the layer view Right click on the layer "countries" and select Change Style

item.title: Change Style
item.description:
Change the layers fill colour by selection the Fill tab then click on the colour button to activate the colour dialog.
Select a new colour and close the dialog.

item.title: Apply
item.description: Click the Apply button to see what this new style looks like on your Map. The Layer view will also be updated to reflect the current style

item.title: Ok
item.description: Click the Ok button if you are happy with your new style.

item.title: XML
item.description: Should you need to do something a little more complex than what the simple or theme pages offer, the XML page allows you to directly modify the Styled Layer Descriptor document (this describes how you would like your layer drawn).

item.title: Style View
item.description: uDig also offers a Style View that can be utilised to perform simple layer styling. To see the Style View in action change to the Style Perspective by selecting Window > Open Perspective > Style Perspective
